post_text: Superintendent Ahmed shared, “Over the past year, we have worked closely with parents, teachers, the Student Youth Voice Engagement Committee and community members to put together a bond proposal based on their concerns and feedback about our aging buildings. Our district is home to many historically rich buildings, including the oldest functioning elementary school building in Michigan. While we are proud of our heritage, our aging buildings desperately require upgrades to support our community’s children. We are disappointed our students will not see improvements to their learning environment. We will continue to work collaboratively with the entire school community to determine what, if any, options we have to significantly improve our learning environment moving forward.”

We are proud of all of our students and their achievements. Class of 2020 is a class that we will remember for many years to come. Among our scholars is Rodua Barua. Anyone that engages in a conversation with Rodua will appreciate his love for the community of Hamtramck. Rodua is Harvard bound and we are so excited for him.

Simon Albaugh from the Yemeni American News reported:
“Hamtramck is one of the most diverse places in the world” Rudua Barua said. It’s that diversity that may have set him apart during the college application process. Coming from a public school system where 16 languages are spoken, Rudua became a high-achieving student under his teachers at Hamtramck High School.

Message from Superintendent Ahmed:
It is times like this, that bring the community together, I applaud the efforts of our central team, school leaders, staff, families, students, school board members, union leaders and city leaders. During the entire time of the COVID-19 situation, everyone came together to understand the situation, create a contingency plan, and ensure that every detail was taken into consideration. This is an unpredictable situation as information and guidance from the county, state, and health organizations continues to evolve and so we will plan and prepare accordingly. Everyone’s patience is appreciated as the district makes informed decisions to support our students and staff.

Coretta Scott King stated that “the greatness of a community is most accurately measured by the compassionate actions of its members”, Hamtramck Community, your compassion is evident during this challenging time. The outpour of volunteers and support from the community has been uplifting.

post_text: Hamtramck Public Schools presents Safe Routes to School Indoor Carnival to be held at Dickinson West and Kosciousko Middle School on January 29th, 2020. The event is from 4pm-7pm for student families who attend our District. Our sponsors Better United Group and Reaching Our Children (ROC) will be providing the following fun stations: face painting, henna, free haircuts, and four live performances from a Clown troop! We will also have bounce houses available as well. We are looking to educate HPS families in the benefit of walking to school. If you are interested in attending please give the signed parental permission slip to your school office no later than Monday, January 27th, 2020. Parent/Guardian must accompany their students who wish to attend.

post_text: There are not enough words to express my gratitude for our talented students, their loving families, our amazing district and school leaders, teachers, paraprofessionals, secretaries, community organizations, city, county and state officials. Dr. King’s words came alive this morning, expressed in various ways by our talented students. We enjoyed their dancing, singing, poetry, jazz and guitar performances. Principal Danforth powerful singing of ‘Hero’ was outstanding. And wow, the Marvelettes graced us with their presence and brought back so many memories. Let us pray for love and peace to prevail from sea to shining sea and continue to lift one another. Thank you all who joined us this morning and we hope to see you all next year. God bless the Concerned Women of Hamtramck and their president Madelyn Porter for their continuous commitment to serving our community. -Superintendent Ahmed @ Hamtramck Public Schools
